name: Tea
instructions: Bring water to a boil in a pot.
Add tea leaves and simmer for 2-3 minutes.
Pour in milk and sugar, then bring to a boil again.
Strain the tea into cups and serve hot.

name: Fried Rice
instructions: Heat oil in a large pan or wok over high heat.
Add chopped vegetables and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Add cooked rice and break up any clumps.
Pour in soy sauce and toss everything together until well combined and heated through.

name: Omelette
instructions: Crack eggs into a bowl, add a pinch of salt, and beat well with a fork.
Heat a pan with oil over medium heat.
Pour the egg mixture into the pan.
Cook for 2-3 minutes, then fold the omelette in half and serve.

name: Grilled Cheese Sandwich
instructions: Butter one side of each slice of bread.
Place one slice butter-side-down in a pan over medium heat.
Add cheese on top, then cover with the other slice of bread, butter-side-up.
Cook for 3-4 minutes per side until the bread is golden and the cheese is melted.

name: Lemonade
instructions: Squeeze juice from the lemons into a pitcher.
Add water and sugar to the pitcher.
Stir until the sugar dissolves completely.
Chill in the refrigerator and serve over ice.

name: Pasta
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil.
Add pasta and cook according to package directions.
Drain the pasta, reserving a little pasta water.
Toss the pasta with tomato sauce and a drizzle of olive oil. Add pasta water if needed.

name: Salad
instructions: Wash and chop the lettuce, tomato, and cucumber.
Place all chopped vegetables in a bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.
Toss gently to combine and serve immediately.

name: French Fries
instructions: Cut potatoes into thin strips.
Heat oil in a deep pot to 350°F (175°C).
Fry the potato strips in batches until golden brown and crispy.
Remove with a slotted spoon, drain on paper towels, and season with salt.

name: Vegetable Soup
instructions: Chop a variety of vegetables into small pieces.
Place vegetables in a pot with water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until vegetables are tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste before serving.

name: Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a large pan.
Add chopped onion and sauté until golden.
Stir in chopped tomato and cook until soft.
Add chicken and spices, then cook until the chicken is tender and the sauce is rich.

name: Fruit Smoothie
instructions: Peel and slice the banana.
Place banana, milk, and sugar in a blender.
Blend on high speed until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
Pour into a glass and serve immediately.

name: Chapati
instructions: Mix flour, salt, and water to form a soft dough.
Knead the dough for 5 minutes.
Roll small portions of dough into thin, flat circles.
Cook each chapati on a hot pan, brushing with oil until it puffs up.

name: Pancakes
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, and egg.
Gradually add milk, whisking until a smooth batter forms.
Heat a pan and melt butter.
Pour a small amount of batter onto the pan and cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook the other side.

name: Poha
instructions: Rinse poha gently and set aside to drain.
Heat oil in a pan and sauté chopped onion until translucent.
Add spices and cook for one minute.
Add the drained poha and salt, stir gently, and cook for 2-3 minutes.

name: Upma
instructions: Roast semolina in a dry pan until fragrant.
Heat oil in a separate pan and sauté chopped onion.
Add water and salt, and bring to a boil.
Slowly pour in the roasted semolina while stirring constantly to prevent lumps.

name: Maggie Noodles
instructions: Break noodles and place in a pot.
Add water and the spice mix packet.
Bring to a boil and cook for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve the noodles hot.

name: Curd Rice
instructions: Mix cooked rice with curd in a bowl.
Add salt to taste and stir until well combined.
For tempering, heat a small amount of oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Pour the hot tempering over the curd rice and mix.

name: Dal Fry
instructions: Cook dal (lentils) in water until tender.
In a separate pan, heat oil and sauté chopped onion until golden.
Add chopped tomato and spices, and cook until the mixture is soft.
Pour the cooked dal into the pan, mix well, and simmer for 5-7 minutes.

name: Masala Chai
instructions: Add water, ginger, and spices to a pot and bring to a boil.
Add tea leaves and simmer for 2 minutes.
Pour in milk and sugar, then bring the mixture to a boil again.
Strain the chai into cups and serve.

name: Vegetable Pulao
instructions: Heat oil in a pot and add spices.
Add chopped vegetables and sauté for 5 minutes.
Stir in rice and salt.
Pour in water, bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and cook until all water is absorbed.
